statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Miami 87, N. Carolina A&T 62
article.story: CORAL GABLES, Fla. (AP) -- Robert Hite and Guillermo Diaz each scored 18 points to lead Miami to an 87-62 win over North Carolina A&T on Tuesday. Diaz has scored in double figures for 32 consecutive games, the longest such streak by an ACC player. The junior guard has scored at least 15 points in each of the 4-1 Hurricanes' five games this season. Demetrius Guions scored 17 points for the Aggies, who fell to 0-2. Miami raced out to an 11-4 lead behind nine points from Hite, but North Carolina A&T mounted a 6-1 run to pull within 12-10 on a three-pointer by Guions. Miami responded with a balanced 17-4 run to take a 29-14 lead with 9:41 remaining in the first half. The Aggies cut the lead to 31-20 on a free throw by Greg Roberts at 6:02, but Miami closed out the half on a 15-7 run to take a 46-27 lead into halftime. Hite scored 12 of his 18 points in the first half, shooting a perfect 4-for-4 from three-point territory. The senior guard finished 7-of-12 overall from the field. The Aggies never got closer than 15 points off Miami's lead in the second half, and the Hurricanes closed the game on a 15-5 run over the final 6:08. Miami shot 48.4 percent from the field, and outrebounded North Carolina A&T 50-27. The Hurricanes also handed out a season-high 19 assists, with Diaz and Hite each distributing a game-high five.
